feat.value: One of the brothers asked Apa Pistamon, 'What should I do? For it worries me when I sell my handiwork.'
The old man answered him, 'Even Apa Sisoes and the others used to sell their handiwork. This is not damaging.
But if you sell, say the price of the item only once. If you want to lower the price a little, that is up to you. In this way you will find peace.'
The brother said to him, 'If I have what I need, do you still want me to be concerned with my handiwork?'
The old man answered, 'Even if you have everything, do not give up on your handiwork. Whatever you are able to do, do itâ€”just don't worry about it.'
